interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Despicable Me 3 [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2017/12/09
Store: Steve Carell  (Actor),     Kristen Wiig  (Actor),     Pierre Coffin  (Director),     Kyle Balda  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ["Illumination, who brought moviegoers Despicable Me, Despicable Me 2, and the biggest animated hit of 2015, Minions, continues the story of Gru, Lucy, their adorable daughters—Margo, Edith and Agnes—and the Minions in Despicable Me 3. After he is fired from the Anti-Villain League for failing to take down Balthazar Bratt, the latest bad guy to threaten humanity, Gru finds himself in the midst of a major identity crisis. But when a mysterious stranger shows up to inform Gru that he has a long-lost twin brother—a brother who desperately wishes to follow in his twin's despicable footsteps—one former super-villain will rediscover just how good it feels to be bad."]
Average Rating: 4.8

Review Text: This Blu Ray is terrible, it didn't want to read until I retried 3 times, then about half way thru, it skipped/paused/went silent etc, then it just jumped to the bonus section after about 5 minutes of inoperation. Will be returning this one and going with a DVD version.
Review Title: Bad Quality Blu-Ray
Rating: 1.0

reference_summary:
The Soldier VHS
Ken Wahl  (Actor),     Alberta Watson  (Actor),     James Glickenhaus  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: VHS Tape
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, MGM Home Entertainment, MGM Movie Time
['New!!! VHS TAPE Sealed (as shown) "The Soldier [VHS]" Fast shipping..(DC-3)']
{'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.13 Ounces', 'Director': 'James Glickenhaus', 'Run time': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 6, 1999', 'Date First Available': 'September 29, 2006', 'Actors': 'Ken Wahl, Alberta Watson, Jeremiah Sullivan, William Prince, Klaus Kinski', 'Studio': 'Fox Home Entertainme'}
Back in the 80s when this was made, i think it was a pretty good flick, it has a weak plot though and some areas could have been expanded upon. But the idea of this movie is so original, I like the idea of our guys stealing one of our own nukes to threaten the Russians who stole some of our nuclear fuel to make a bomb and put it in the Saudi oil fields in an attempt to get the Israeli's off the west bank. It feels like a class B movie, but it is enjoyable all the same. This movie would make a great remake if done today, and considering some of the garbage that has been released lately, this one would be a big hit.
Great concept for storyline
High Road to China
Tom Selleck  (Actor),     Bess Armstrong  (Actor),     Brian G. Hutton  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
["Take the high road to adventure with Tom Selleck and Bess Armstrong in this freewheeling action-comedy set in the Roaring Twenties. Selleck stars as Patrick O'Malley, a boozing, washed-up aviator who meets his match when he's hired by a high-strung heiress to find her long lost father. They make their way eastward in O'Malley's WWI biplane, surviving narrow escapes, last second rescues, and combat with warlords along the way. But nothing tops the ongoing battle they have with each other - the one which leads inevitably to romance."]

profile:
The user continues to exhibit a passionate interest in movies, particularly from the 1980s and 1990s, favoring action and thriller genres. They appreciate original storylines, valuing creativity and innovative concepts over technical execution, which aligns with their fondness for nostalgic and cult classic films. Although they recently engaged with contemporary animated cinema, their experience with a Blu-ray format highlighted a preference for reliability and quality in viewing, as they expressed dissatisfaction with poor playback issues, leading them to revert to DVD. 

Their critical yet positive approach remains evident; they celebrate beloved films while acknowledging shortcomings, suggesting a thoughtful engagement with cinematic works that prioritize meaningful narratives and emotional connections. They have shown openness to remakes of older films, reflecting a belief in contemporary interpretations. This recent interaction reinforces their focus on quality, emphasizing a desire for an enjoyable viewing experience, alongside a nostalgic attachment to classic cinema and a readiness to explore different formats. Overall, the user’s profile showcases a balance between a strong appreciation for themed creativity in storytelling and a discerning attitude towards the quality of the media they consume.
